Maria was a young human and the granddaughter of Gerald Robotnik and the cousin of Dr. Eggman. Born and raised on the Space Colony ARK, Maria suffered from a terminal illness. To save Maria, Gerald agreed to work on Project Shadow in hopes of using the fruits of the research to find a cure for her. Gerald's research produced Shadow the Hedgehog, who Maria became close friends with. When GUN later tried to shut down the ARK, Maria was killed when trying to assist Shadow in his escape from the colony.

Now to dump a ton of personality description.

While frail in appearance, Maria was strong in spirit. She was eternally cheerful, optimistic and positive despite her condition, and could see the good in almost anyone or anything. She was likewise a very kind, caring and thoughtful soul who always put others before herself, supported her friends, and held an unconditional love for the people of the world, even showing compassion to enemies. Because she never got down to earth, Maria was interested in it and wished to see it. She was as well very encouraging as she could make others accept themselves and calm others when in stressful situations, including Shadow.
Maria was one who found it easier than most to forgive and forget, not to mention trust. Even after GUN violently raided the ARK and shot her, Maria did not hold any ill will or grudge towards the people on earth and only wished them to live happy lives. She was also was utterly selfless as she ultimately sacrificed herself for Shadow's sake, having faith he would carry out her dreams for her.
Despite her youth and frailness, Maria was brave, determined, and had a strong sense of righteousness. When the Artificial Chaos were on a rampage Maria wanted to stop them to save the innocent, and during the GUN's raid on the ARK she refused to leave the injured researchers behind. Even on her deathbed, Maria remained undeterred and only wished Shadow to fulfill his purpose.

"Awww" you say.
I would have to agree in some way, as Sega has stopped making new Sonic characters for the games for a while surprisingly. If there will be new female characters, I will be shocked a bit, but not too much.

So at this point I had to dig up a character that was never created, but rather planned to be in a cancelled Sonic game for the Sega Saturn. Yeah, we obscure now boys 'n girls! (also remember that I usually take these descriptions from other websites)

Tiara was developed to be a spunky female protagonist who could match Sonic the Hedgehog in attitude. Christian Senn later admitted that, should she have ever materialized completely, she would be a "girl power" character. She varied from the typical "damsel in distress" seen in the Sonic the Hedgehog video game series. Senn's first sketches were stick figures. From there, he created an initial design that deviated from a real Manx in the same way that Sonic deviated from a real hedgehog. He states that the similarities (both in appearance and personality) between Tiara and Princess Sally Acorn were unintentional.

A series of four color designs were created for discussion purposes in 1995. Each retained the same basic facial and hair designs, but varied in terms of clothing. Proposed designs included a form-fitting red dress, a tank top with miniskirt, and a midriff-bearing version of the former. A design featuring no clothing changed her fur pattern. For the second to last design, Senn used the midriff-bearing design using a red and yellow color scheme. However, Michael Kosaka envisioned the character as having more attitude, so Senn changed her accordingly. Along with her stance and visual demeanor, her clothing style changed dramatically. She was given tight pants, a bikini top, and tennis shoes. Additionally, her hair was shortened. Chris Senn felt this design conveyed her attitude, but after the game was cancelled he admitted that her original, cuter design was his favorite.
1411311222222222222222222.title: Tiara Boobowski

14113211.content:
Winter was without a doubt your favorite season, a time when white specs drifted from the overcast sky, landing upon layers of white snow; it was so beautiful, so pure, so serene, so quiet.

Colorful lights mounted on homes you walked by were flashing brightly, and their decorations - plastic statues of deer pulling Santa Clues' sled, snowmen with a carrot for a nose, black rocks for eyes, smile, and buttons, and twigs for limbs - stood proudly on their front lawns.

As you walk down the street, with a box wrapped in red plastic wrap displaying candy canes, towards a two-story, wooden house at the end of the cul-de-sac, you could not help but feel very excited, threatening to put a smile on your expressionless face.

This Christmas eve was more than special to you, for it marked the two year and a half anniversary since you fell down into the Underground, where your fantastic adventures began, where your life completely changed.

You couldn't wait to get home, spent the evening with friends, help Toriel decorate the Christmas tree, and lay presents under it. It was a tradition you two always did...but this year things were going to be different.

The moment you walked up the porch and entered the house, you saw Toriel standing in the living-room, wearing her special dress: it had long sleeves, a skirt that fell just past her knees, and it was such a deep shade of blue that it was almost black.

Around her neck was pair of gleaming pearls, and thrown over her shoulder was the strap of a white handbag. The strong but sweet smell of roses came from her, and you knew she used her expensive perfume.

Your eyebrows raised slightly in surprise. You knew very well what this meant: Toriel was going Someplace special, and this also meant (which was rare) that you weren't going to be taken along.

But where and why was the most important questions here.

Toriel turned and noticed you. "O, hello there, my child," she said in her typical kind voice, smiling, "I'm glad your home so soon from the shops. O, is that your present? Go put it under the tree, my dear. Where am I going? Don't you remember, child? I'm going on a date with Asgore."

You felt like slapping your forehead. Of course! How could you have forgotten? She'd been talking about it for the past week now. Apparently Asgore had invited her to his house for dinner. It was his attempt of getting her back, but you knew that Toriel was uninterested, only doing it because she didn't want him to feel bad.

"I'm so sorry that I can't take you along, but you know how dates are: there's only room for two and no more," she said walking towards the closed door, opening it just when there was a knock on the wood, revealing Alphys and Undyne on the other side, dressed in warm clothing. "I really didn't want to leave you alone tonight, that's why I took the liberty to get you a babysitter."

O, the irony! You braved the vast expanse of the Underground, fought off creatures that wished to harm you, escaped Boss Monsters that tried to capture you and harness your soul, and defeated not one but two nearly invincible entities, but still you needed someone to look after you.

You guessed that overprotective caretakers were overprotective.

"Sup there, kid," greeted Undyne, grinning.

"Hi," said Alphys timidly, "Are you ready to decorate that tree?"

She lifted up a transparent, plastic bag, which clearly showed colorful lights bulbs, a golden star, and other Christmas decorations.

You smiled and waved your hands in greeting before you nodded at Alphys in agreement.

The duo then turned to Toriel. "I'm so glad you were able to look after Frisk tonight," she said.

"It's no problem," said Undyne

"Okay then," Toriel said, "I guess I'll be off. Goodbye, my child, behave yourself well."

You stood on the porch and waved as Toriel drove away. After that, you went inside and spent the evening with Undyne and Alphys, decorating the tree and...well, that's it.

Toriel's absence had the ability to dull the mood. It wasn't that you found it boring to hang out with the two; in fact, you liked spending time with your old friends, but it just wasn't the same without Toriel.

You retired early, not even staying for the Christmas special they had on TV. Jumping into your blue pajamas, which ironically had pictures of yellow flowers on them, you climbed in your bed.

You yawned and fell asleep, thinking that you'll be woken up by Toriel the following morning or find a slice of pie next to your bed.

She didn't come home that night.
14113211.title: Underpreg.

choices: As time passes, Toriel begins to display odd behavior.
141132111.content:
It was going to be a bright, clear, and unusually warm day for winter. Unfortunately it was not Toriel nor the nice smell of Snail Pie that woke you up, but it was annoying ringing of your red alarm clock, set early.

After silencing the noisy contraption, you sit up in your bed, yawning and stretching, smacking your lips. Looking through the window that stood just opposite of you, you saw the rolling snowy hills, its beauty intensified by the rising sun.

As you sit there, rubbing the sleep from your eyes, a thought suddenly entered your mind: today was Christmas, and it filled you with Determination!

Launching yourself from from the bed, you dashed out of the room in your pajamas, not even bothering to put on normal clothing.

Your first destination was Toriel's room. She would still be asleep this time of the day, and you always enjoyed giving her a rude awakening by jumping on her bed.

But, like yesterday, things were different again; when you entered the room, you saw that Toriel's bed was empty and already made up, like no one even slept in it at all.

A little bit concerned and surprised, you shrugged it off, thinking that perhaps she got up earlier than you did, and she downstairs, waiting to surprise you with a camera.

But when you reached the ground floor you saw that she wasn't there either. Instead, sleeping on the couch was your two babysitters.

A snot bubble was inflated and deflating from Undyne's noise as she snored softly, and Alphys was snuggled on top of her, sleeping soundly, a grey blanket covering them.

Spread out over the table, you saw, was DVDs depicting colorful cartoon characters of numerous anime TV series and movies. You guessed they spent most of the night watching these before they fell asleep.

You were debating with yourself if you should wake them up, for you really wanted to open your presents and you didn't want to do it alone, but you also thought that it would be rude disturbed their slumber.

But your pondering was suddenly interrupted when you heard the sound of a car pulling into the house's driveway.

The noise had an obvious effect on the sleeping couple, for they woke up, and Undyne asked: "What's all the racus. I'm trying to sleep here."

"I-I think Toriel's back home," said Alphys just when the sound of a car's door shutting came from outside.

"Finally!" exclaimed Undyne, "She's been out all night!"

There was a knock on the door, and you went and opened it, revealing, as expected, Toriel on the other side, but she did not look so fresh as she did last night: her fur looked ruffled, her dressed wrinkled, her pearls she wore last night were missing, and she looked tired.

You were alarmed by the condition Toriel was in, but when you attempted to ask her what happened, Alphys, who got up from the couch to greet her friend, beat her to it, exclaiming: "O, my! Toriel, what happened to you?"

"Yeah!" said Undyne, "And where the hell were you last night?"

"Don't be alarmed," said Toriel, trying to calm everyone down, "I'm perfectly fine. My car just broke down and I was forced to stay at Asgore's. I'm very sorry that you two had to wait the whole night for me, and, Frisk, I'm also sorry. You were probably worried sick about me."

You smiled and hugged, indicating that there was no hard feelings and you didn't mind it at all, but you could tell that there was something that Toriel was hiding from you.

"Well then," said Undyne, smiling, "How was it staying with King Fluffybuns? I hope you survived the entire night with him begging you to get back together with him"

"O, it wasn't bad staying with him for the night," said Toriel, attempting to smile friendly, but it looked more sheepishly, and you swore that you saw a faint blush come to her cheeks. "He gave me a lot of space and even my own bedroom, so, it was rather okay night."

"Excuse me for asking this," Alphys suddenly said, "But how did you get the car fixed so fast?"

Toriel seemed to grow nervous when she heard that question. "O-o...umm...Asgore is quite the technician. Can you believe it? H-he spent all night fixing it for me. How convenient, hey?"

"But wait," said Undyne, "Asgore is more of a gardener type of guy. Why would he want to get his ha-"

She was suddenly cut off when Toriel zipped behind the couple and pushed them out the door quickly, saying, "You all must be very tired. I bet you two really want to go home now."

"Wai-" Undyne tried again, but she gently shoved them out the door, closing it in their faces.

She spun on her heels, saying to you, "You probably want to open the presents now, don't you? But just excuse me for a few minutes while I wash up."

And with that said, Toriel left, going straight to the bathroom. You were a little confused at what just transpired. You knew, if it wasn't obvious enough, that not all was what it seemed.
141132111.title: All is not what it seems.

choices: Yes, and you leave her alone that night.
No! This was going on long enough. You must know what's going on.
1411321111.content:
Time passed. Christmas came and went, and from it you received a well-knitted blue sweater Toriel made, depicting in the very center the picture of a...flower? Seriously, you had to ask her to make clothing that displayed something else that did not remind you of Flowey. It almost felt like that accursed flower had to have the last giggle, making you see its shadow everywhere you went.

Anyway, it was just a few days after the New Year that Toriel began to display odd behavior: on certain days she had the most bizarre taste for food (seriously, who eats Snail Pie with ketchup, mustard, and ice cream?"), and on other days she had out if control mood-swings, such as her being so happy that she didn't care when you accidentally broke one of her antique plates, or her exploding in fury when Papyrus left a coffee stain on her kitchen table, threatening to incinerate him, or when she burst out in tears when Sans told her a joke with a sad plot but with a funny punchline.

In some morning, while going to the bathroom, you would find Toriel hanging over the toilet, throwing up. She would say she'd just caught a stomach bug, but she was feeling much better now.

You were growing very concerned. Pondering for many days, you tried to diagnose Toriel's odd behavior, but you just couldn't figure out what's going on. All of this seemed to point towards that one date night Toriel and Asgore had, but you just couldn't ask them openly, for you believed that it was a little too personal.

But it was on one night that all your burning questions would be answered. It was late, and you were heading down to the kitchen for a glass of juice, but when you stumbled into the room, rubbing your left eye, you spotted Toriel.

Recently she had been complaining about how it was too hot for her, ten spite the fact that it was still winter, and she traded her traditional clothing for a white, sleeveless dress.

That was why it wasn't odd when you saw that Toriel was dressed in nothing but her underwear. It was then that you noticed some big differences on her, differences you could never see because of the puffy clothing she wore: her breasts was swollen, her erect nipples pushing against the fabric of her bra, and her belly had a slight, but noticeable, curve.

She was busy making her ketchup-pie monstrosity when she noticed you standing in the room. "O, hello there, my child," she said, "I did not expect you up this time of night. Did you want anything?"

You pointed towards her swollen belly, and Toriel looked at it with shock, as if noticing it for the first time.

"O-o, that?" said Toriel, growing nervous, "It seems that I'm gaining a little pudge. I probably should watch what I'm eating. It's nothing to be concerned of, really."

But did you believe her explanation?
1411321111.title: The odd behavior begins.

14113211112.content:
No! You did not believe her, and the need to know what's going on filled you with Determination. Curling your hands into fists, placing them on your sides, you leaned forward and gave Toriel the sternest look you could muster.

Beads of sweat appeared on her forehead and she bit her lower lip. "Alright," Toriel finally said with a sigh, "I'll tell you the truth: Frisk, my dear, I'm with child."

Your stern attitude dropped, and your eyebrows raised and mouth dropped open in surprise. So that's why she was acting so strange; the hormones she was experiencing from the pregnancy was making her eat, feel, and do odd stuff.

"You see," she continued, "My car never broke down when I went on a date with Asgore. We had a pleasant dinner that night, and I had a wine glass too many. We got caught up in the old days, the days before when we were still together, living happily with our children, and I got sad, allowing a comforting kiss to go way too far. I slept with him willingly that night, and now it would seem that I carry his offspring ones more. O, Frisk! I'm not sure if I'll be ready to have another child, especially after I lost one!"

You could hear the worry, the sadness, the distress in her voice, so, you moved in to hug her tightly. It seemed to help her, for she calmed down and hugged you back.

"You're right, my child," she said, "I must stay Determined. I can make it through this."

You smiled, snuggling into her soft belly, and for a brief moment you could have sworn hearing the beat of the fetus' small heart inside.
14113211112.title: No! You demand an explanation.

choices: Skip to the day of the birth.
141132111121.content:
The months passed, and Toriel's belly got bigger and bigger as the fetus developed inside, pulling at her spine, causing her to jut out her belly as she walked, resulting in a cute waddle.

Her breasts swelled also as more milk filled it, and was still a prominent feature even when she went back to wearing her old dress.

Her nipples, alongside her bellybutton, which popped out somewhere during the fifth month, pushed against the fabric of her clothing.

On a quiet day, during early July, Toriel would often go sit outside on the porch on her rocking chair, caressing her soccer ball-sized belly, watching the tree on her front lawn blooming and enjoying the feeling of the cool breeze brush against her face.

When she did this, you would come outside, placing your hands and ear against her stomach, trying to hear the baby's heartbeat and feel its kicks.

Everything was so peaceful...until Asgore found out about it. Toriel didn't want him knowing anything about her condition, so, she made everyone promise not to tell him.

Someone, you didn't know who (perhaps it was Papyrus; he had a big mouth and nasty habit of allowing secrets to slip during a conversation), told Asgore that his ex-wife was expecting, and that the child was his.

Though, you had to admit that Toriel was only delaying the inevitable. Asgore would have found out about it sooner or later, for she ignored his phone calls and letters requesting for another date, and the fact that she took work leave from the school she worked at was suspicious enough.

What he did next was to be expected:

It was on a rainy day, and you were keeping busy in the living room drawing pictures using crayons. Toriel was sitting on a sofa nearby, wearing her glasses and reading a book, her feet resting on a soft footstool.

Every now and then she would pause and give her swollen belly a tender rub, groaning softly, most likely feeling the baby's uncomfortable kicking.

The sound of a car stopping in the driveway disturbed the relaxed mood, and Toriel sat the book down on her lap, saying: "Now who might that be?"

A few moments later there was the sound of heavy footsteps on the wooden flooring of the porch, followed by a few knocks on the door.

Not wanting Toriel to rise to her feet in her current state, you answered the door for her. On the other side was Asgore, his burly figure looming over you, his hair and clothing looking a little wet from the pouring rain outside, but he was luckily under the porch's tin roof now.

"O, hello there, Frisk," he said in his typical deep voice, "Is Toriel here? I need to speak to her."

You nodded and went to get her, but you saw her coming to the door anyway. You stepped aside, allowing her to confront him.

"O, it's you," she said, her kind attitude dropping when she saw who it was, glaring at him, "What do you want?"

"Toriel!" Asgore cried, a big, but sheepish, smile appearing on his face, "You've gotten so...big."

"I'm going to pretend that was a compliment," she said, her eyes closed, frowning as she tried to conceal her frustration, stroking her belly. "What do you want Asgore?"

He sighed. "Alright, Toriel," he said, "But before I say anything, may I come in? It's kinda cold out here."

"Sure," said Toriel, folding her arms, "We'll talk in the kitchen. Do you want some tea?"

"That would be great, thanks," Asgore said, stepping inside, "Next to pie baking, you always had a magnificent skill at making tea."

"Please, don't try to flatter me, Asgore," Toriel said.

Normally you were against eavesdropping , but this conversation you had to hear, so, you hid behind the corner leading to the kitchen, catching a peek into the room whenever you dared.

The kettle was steaming and Toriel took it off the stove, filling the cups of tea with boiling water.

"Thank you," said Asgore when he received his drink.

Toriel sat opposite to him at the table, blowing her cup cold first before speaking to him. "So, what do you want to talk about?" she asked, already knowing the answer.

"About all this," said Asgore, gesturing towards her pregnant belly, "Why didn't you tell me that you were expecting?"

"Why do you care!" Toriel snapped, "It's your fault all this happened."

"I care greatly, Toriel," said Asgore with a serious tone, looking offended, "You know me better than that. We were ones married, and you know me as a compassionate father, a person that cares."

Toriel looked away, a guilty look crossing her face.

"Toriel," he said, stretching out his big hand and taking her smaller one in it, "The child you are carrying is mine also, and face it: we need each other now."

Toriel then did something very unexpected, something you've never seen her do: she began to cry softly, salty tears spilling over her eyelids and soaking her fur.

"O, Toriel," Asgore said, quickly rushing to her side and hugging her, her thin body practically disappearing in his thick arms.

She didn't try to push away, but she buried her head in his muscular chest, still weeping softly, her sobs rocking her body. Asgore tried to calm her down, shushing her and saying kind things.

It took a while before she finally calmed down, and when she did she said in a a voice so low that you had to strain yourself to hear: "I-I never wanted another child. I-I-It feels like I'm replacing Asriel."

"Your not, my dear," Asgore said, "We're just...having another baby, that's all, another child to look after."

"I never would have guessed that we would get back together this way, Fluffybuns," said Toriel, pulling away from him.

"You haven't called me that in a while," Asgore said.

"I know."


They looked in each other's eyes for a few moments, and then they kissed.

You knew that this was the start of a new beginning, and you smiled.

144311.title: 1) From Games

1443111.content:
Chapter 1: Attack of the Metal Dragon!!

*Beep beep be-SMASH!* Amy never liked the sound of alarm clocks in the morning, seeing as she just smashed one with her Piko Piko hammer not even a few moments ago, but she needed one today for a specific reason. Today she was going on a date with Sonic and needed to look her best before spending the whole day with him! Even though he keeps on insisting it isn't a date and he is just "going to get back the Chaos Emerald that Amy "conveniently" had with her possession after Sonic found one and she visited Tail's place to say hi to them".

As Amy gets all clean, dresed, and prepared for her quote/unquote date, there are bigger and even more evil things happening afoot.

Eggman's Secret Base

*BEEP BEEP BEEP BE-SMASH!!* Speaking of bigger, Eggman recently has been trying to think up a new master plan for days now.

"Ow! Oww! OWW! That hurt!" Cubot screamed out.

"Listen, you agreed to be my alarm clock, and while you things can wake a man up in the morning, you're still annoying," Eggman says as he gets out of bed still in pajamas and his night cap.

"Cubot, if you think you're having a hard time, imagine being the alarm clock smasher," Orbot says, also in pain.

"Enough of the two of you, zip it, I need to change and get fresh, for today I shall come up with a plan to take over the world!"

"You say that every day, and I never ever loose hope on you Doctor. Mostly because you programmed me to say that every time you say you have a new plan," Orbot says, snarking at Eggman.

A Few Moments Later

Alright, I'm ready.

"Wow Doc, that was a quick, uhh, freshen up," Cubot says

"Yeah, it's not that hard nor takes that long to get ready for the day,"

In Amy's House

"Oh no I still need to fix my quills, and which outfit should I wear? The pink Go-Go outfit or the pink athletic wear? And where did I leave that Emerald? Oh nonononono, where is my boots!"

Back at Eggman's Base

"Anyway, while thinking of how I can defeat Sonic, I thought of one major flaw in my plans. My Egg Capsules,"

"Your Egg Capsules Doctor?" Orbot asks, "What is the problem with them?"

"You see, inside the Capsules are the animals I take to later turn into badniks. Problem is that Sonic always releases those animals before I get a chance to turn them into robots in the first place, and that makes me so angry, that for the longest time I stopped using badniks, only to use them again and still fail to take them before he releases them!" Eggman screams to the heavens with eternal rage and madness.

"Wait, instead of having the animals inside a capsule to later be turned to robots, why not have robots inside the animals?" as Cubot said that Eggman was ready to smack him upside his head again with Orbot, but while he had Orbot in the air he stops and thinks about what Cubot just says and lets go of Orbot, causing the poor robot to fall to the ground.

"Why yes Cubot of course, let the animals become carriers of the badnicks! Good job Cubot,"

"Why shucks Eggman, I'm just happy to hel-"

"Glad I thought of it and happy to help, of course you are," Eggman interrupted as he walks away to his work bench and proceeds to work on the blue prints.

"But... I thought of..." Cubot says, completely confused on what just happened,

"Oh don't worry Cubot, you should feel lucky. Sometimes when the Doctor comes up with a plan that was not originally his own, he BLOWS up the one who did to make sure the original person who made the idea wouldn't dare claim it to be his, be it they survive. Plus he gets cranky when he hasn't had enough sleep," Orbot says.

Eggman looks at previous blueprints of previous robots he made, and scans through them quickly. He thinks to himself on what would be the perfect machine for the job of what is basically, forced robot breeding. " I need something big, something hard to destroy so Sonic and his annoying friends won't have an easy time trying to defeat the thing. So nothing small," Eggman throws all the blueprints for small robots and continues to thinks to himself. "Okay, now what needs to be in here is something to distinguish life forms, able to tell size and what's male and what's female. I'll probably have an Egg Pawn inside the thing to control it." Eggman then throws the blueprints to any giant sized robot without a way to enter it, and to access and control it. "Now what can be good to use, I have three robots here, the Egg-Wyvern, Egg Viper, and Egg Dragoon. And if I need to use any of these, I need to do some serious remodeling." After countless minutes, Eggman decided "Why not mix the three?! I'll get the sleekness of the Viper, the wings of the Wyvern, and the artillery and pod placements of the Dragoon, and mix them all together to see what I can come up with. Of course the artillery must be changed for, different purposes," Eggman grabs the three blueprints and starts to draw out a mix, and eventually comes up with this, "I'll use the Viper as the base, but make the bottom half slimmer so it'll be closer to what the Dragoon had and add a pod on the lower half as well as the top of the dragon. Next we add the wings of the Wyvern onto the base, and make them more flexible and able to close them inward. Next we add legs, but they only come out when the Egg Dragon needs to land, so in the air the Egg Dragon can look like a Chinese style dragon with wings. Then, the weapons of the Dragoon will be changed to do things other than shot and kill. Of course it can still do that for self protection, but lets change what the left arm can do. When preparing for insemination, the Dragon detracts the attack drill, and retracts a phallic looking drill instead, for the purposes of what it was built for, forced breeding. The right arm and be changed to grab creatures easier and not kill them once grabbed. Ooooh, also adding a scary metal dragon head. It'll look cool and evil!" Eggman finishes up his drawing of the beast, and lifts it up in the air once he's finished.

"I'M FINISHED!" Eggman cries out with pride.

"Amazing Doctor, it's quite amazing what you can do when properly motivated. Hopefully this won't blunder up on your face like usual, eh?" Orbot says with sass and properness.

"I know it's icky, but it may be my only way of succeeding in world domination. While everyone will be willing to open up an Egg Capsule and destroy a robot to release the animals inside them, no one is willing to kill a pregnant woman, even if the "baby" inside her is a robot bent on my command for world domination! BWAHAHAHAHAHA! BWAHAHAHAA-- *cough cough couuuugh*. Oh man I need to clean my throat before doing that," Eggman staggers a bit and hands over the prints. "Now excuse me, I'm going to make everlasting robot semen,"

Eggman walks away to another room in the base, and Orbot and Cuebot proceed to look at each other in disgust and shiver.

One Hour Later and Outside Amy's House

Amy gets outside her front door, feeling the fresh sun on her face, and gets pumped up to have (in her mind) a perfect day. She brings the Chaos Emerald she stole, I mean borrowed and heads to the spot she and Sonic agreed to meet at for their date. The only thing that can ruin her day would be if Eggman decides to ruin everything by trying to take over the world, or Sonic making up dumb stories to explain why he's not where they agreed to meet up for the date. But just as Amy thought that, she hears a loud screech from afar and feels heavy winds from the direction of the screech.

So at this point I had to dig up a character that was never created, but rather planned to be in a cancelled Sonic game for the Sega Saturn. Yeah, we obscure now boys 'n girls! (also remember that I usually take these descriptions from other websites)

Tiara was developed to be a spunky female protagonist who could match Sonic the Hedgehog in attitude. Christian Senn later admitted that, should she have ever materialized completely, she would be a "girl power" character. She varied from the typical "damsel in distress" seen in the Sonic the Hedgehog video game series. Senn's first sketches were stick figures. From there, he created an initial design that deviated from a real Manx in the same way that Sonic deviated from a real hedgehog. He states that the similarities (both in appearance and personality) between Tiara and Princess Sally Acorn were unintentional.

A series of four color designs were created for discussion purposes in 1995. Each retained the same basic facial and hair designs, but varied in terms of clothing. Proposed designs included a form-fitting red dress, a tank top with miniskirt, and a midriff-bearing version of the former. A design featuring no clothing changed her fur pattern. For the second to last design, Senn used the midriff-bearing design using a red and yellow color scheme. However, Michael Kosaka envisioned the character as having more attitude, so Senn changed her accordingly. Along with her stance and visual demeanor, her clothing style changed dramatically. She was given tight pants, a bikini top, and tennis shoes. Additionally, her hair was shortened. Chris Senn felt this design conveyed her attitude, but after the game was cancelled he admitted that her original, cuter design was his favorite.

So, do what you want with her, because there is LITERALLY no more female Sonic characters from the games that I have for you to jerk off/write stories for... however, I will make a thread for cartoon characters and will now try to copy-past these posts and put them in the other areas for Pregnant at the very least.
